description: The player faced the wrath of Twitter users for his pop-culture gaffe.
title: 'Jeopardy!' Contestant Roasted After Mistaking Janet Jackson For Ariana Grande
title_page: 'Jeopardy!' Contestant Roasted After Mistaking Janet Jackson For Ariana Grande | HuffPost
maintext:
A â€œJeopardy!â€ contestant is getting razzed on social media for this egregious pop-culture blunder.
During Wednesday nightâ€™s episode of the game show, contestant Alwin Hui answered â€œWho is Ariana Grandeâ€ to a clue after footage played of 53-year-old music icon Janet Jackson singing her 1986 hit â€œNasty.â€
â€œAs the recipient of the 2018 Icon Award, she took â€œControlâ€ and took to the stage in her first live TV performance in nearly a decade,â€ the clue said before a clip was played of Jacksonâ€™s performance at the 2018 Billboard Music Awards.
Grande, 26, would have been 14 a decade before the award was handed out.
Jacksonâ€™s high ponytail, oversized shirt and thigh-high boots â€• similar to Grandeâ€™s signature look â€• appeared to confuse the contestant:
Between this and the Chaka Khan moment earlier in the week, itâ€™s clear our nationâ€™s nerds are in desperate need of doing some music icon homework. COME ON, ALWIN. #Jeopardy pic.twitter.com/DtuTTUmGYO â€” Bradley Stern (@MuuMuse) April 29, 2020
Viewers, many of whom were apparently still reeling from another hilarious mixup earlier in the week when a contestant confused Chaka Khan with Shaka Zulu, were quick to deliver another roasting for the gaffe:
Forget the innocent Chaka Khan slip from last night, this egregious response on tonightâ€™s #Jeopardy is the true blasphemy pic.twitter.com/KUfYSUe1TE â€” Kevin Fallon (@kpfallon) April 30, 2020
They just showed a video of Janet Jackson dancing and this dude said "who is Ariana Grande?" #Jeopardy pic.twitter.com/ttOxTZ7hA7 â€” misSANDeI (@dunn_ryte) April 29, 2020
At least one â€œJeopardy!â€ watcher was willing to cut him some slack, though.
In my manâ€™s defense, it clip was a wide shot, so maybe he needed a closer look. ğŸ˜‚ Maybe the â€œAriana-ishâ€ ponytail threw him off. pic.twitter.com/oNMQAAabAf â€” Roy Wood Jr- Ex Jedi (@roywoodjr) April 29, 2020
